author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body: Please add julia compat. Also, kinda weird with the word "App" twice in the package name :)

> Please add julia compat.

I've added `[compat] julia = 1` to `master`. I tried re-typing `@JuliaRegistrator register()`, but it's now saying `An unexpected error occured during registration.` (https://github.com/NHDaly/ApplicationBuilderAppUtils.jl/issues/1#issuecomment-487590872)

Any idea what i'm supposed to do differently? Or is the Registrator just temporarily down?



> Also, kinda weird with the word "App" twice in the package name :)

Haha yeah I know... I agree with you, but don't have any better ideas.

It's cause these are utilities _for the apps_ being built with ApplicationBuilder. That is, users are encouraged to add a dependency to this package if they want to get runtime OS information from inside their app. Before, I was injecting this functionality into the program being compiled, but it was very flaky.

I didn't want to name it `ApplicationBuilderUtils`, because it's not utilities _for building Apps_, it's utilities to be accessed _from the apps themselves_. But they'll only work if you used `ApplicationBuilder` to build your app. Do you have any other good suggestions? :) I'd appreciate some help. :)

Probably just something wrong with Registrator.

No, I don't really have a suggestion.
